result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard L Oliver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court would approve transfer of probation to another State for treatment.

miscConds.notes: Restitution of $536.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation to Walmart.  Restitution for case 14CM1385 to also be paid as a Condition of Probation on this case.

No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Attend a minimum of 2 self meetings per week.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs waived.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with standard release conditions-All 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.

Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 04-30-15
DRC Informational Court Report.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Richard L Oliver in court, in custody, with attorney Christopher Paul Ehrfurth.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State filed an Amended Information.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following:
- 9 months Huber with standard release conditions. STAYED
- 1 year Probation.  Court would approve transfer of probation to another State for treatment.
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Restitution of $536.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation to Walmart
- Conditions of Probation:  Pay restitution as outlined above and in 14CM1385.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Valid prescriptions to be taken in the manner they were prescribed and must be verified to Agent.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  

CONDITION TIME: 60 days - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - All 60 days STAYED and defendant to be released to Day Report Center for compliance for 90 days.
